main event: Navy Captain Paul Coscarelli reported a sighting of an unidentified object with an elliptical shape on December 17, 1953.
interesting points: The sighting was made using air-intercept radar which indicated a large unidentified radar target traveling west at high speed, approximately 2300 knots., The object left a trail that gave it a comet-like appearance., The altitude of the object ranged between 15,000 and 23,992 feet., The weather conditions at the time included cloudy skies with winds at 12 knots., The sighting lasted for a total of 4 minutes.
